Articles.Content: Forgot to say. There's an IRC channel on espernet now, too. #ScienceOfTheSpheres, or access it here: http://webchat.esper.net/?nick=&channels=#ScienceOfTheSpheres&fg_color=000000&fg_sec_color=000e63&bg_color=ffffff

Forgot to say. There's an IRC channel on espernet now, too. #ScienceOfTheSpheres, or access it here: http://webchat.esper.net/?nick=&channels=#ScienceOfTheSpheres&fg_color=000000&fg_sec_color=000e63&bg_color=ffffff

!!!Noob Question Alert!!!

How does I use an IRC?

!!!Noob Question Alert!!!

How does I use an IRC?

Click on it enter your username in the box and click connect. Then the bar at the bottom is the part that you put your msg in and enter sends it. The middle bit is the main part of the IRC showing what other users are saying. The right bit shows what users are on.
I'm into anything that looks space/nerdy and fun! I might look deeper into this

Creating harpoon launcher. Elected to switch from a gas-based launch mechanism to a mechanical system.

eg. space crossbow ^

Further developed crossbow:

Rather, I suppose it's more of a ballista, given the arms don't flex and instead use torsion.

Going to shorten the arms and increase the bulk of the joints, to give it more of a ballista shape...

Edited May 15, 2014 by NovaSilisko

A Few Questions from GregroxMun.

Will there be multiple "tiers" of projectile weapon? Can we expect Estes-Rocket powered Missiles with a PVC potato-canon launcher?

Will there be any Easter Eggs perhaps referencing a certain game about little green men exploring space?

It the game meant to be easily modded like KSP?

Will it be possible to create new planetary systems from scratch, and if so will that be via mods, cfg files, or high-tier technology?

Should I get some sleep, it's really late...

Are stars large SGCs or regular SGCs with lots of matter stuck to them?

Will black holes be possible? Would there even be a point to having black holes, if that's essentially just what an SGC is?

Will there be any gravitational sources that move?

How would you go about abducting Orange Slime Cubes? Or Chickens?

Will there be some form of procedurally generated creatures, so that you don't just have repetitious creatures over and over again?

What if you had two SGCs in one planet?

In the "Umbra" Concept art (The reddish spacerock), do those jets on it push the spacerock around at all?

Do SGCs have static size, density, or gravity? Can different SGCs have different Gravitational attraction? Do they have different diameters? Do they have varying densities? Are all SGCs Identical?

Can SGCs be destroyed? If so, what happens to the planet?

Will there be sandbox-style tools to do things like superheat planets, or freeze them (kind of like Spore Space Stage)?

Is Dr. Tony Pistachio all alone is the MEA facility?

Could Microspace Tourism/Manned MicroSpaceflight be a possibility?

If you hadn't already planned on any of these things, did I give you ideas about them?

Edited May 16, 2014 by GregroxMun

Will there be multiple "tiers" of projectile weapon? Can we expect Estes-Rocket powered Missiles with a PVC potato-canon launcher?

There probably will be a few tiers of harpoon, yeah. This would be the super heavy duty one, smaller ones probably would be powered by compressed gas.

By the way, I've updated my IRC notification settings so it should be easier to get my attention in the IRC chat. I keep missing whenever you come in, Gregrox
I like that SoTS IRC links to XKCD What If's Little Planet.
May make a blog post about the development history of the game up til now... might also release the first playable prototype from around July 2013 or so.
Hmm, you should Nova. Also a prototype in July? Awesome!
July 30th is my birthday

May make a blog post about the development history of the game up til now... might also release the first playable prototype from around July 2013 or so.

Please! I'd like to see how it's been evolving since it's conception.

Please! I'd like to see how it's been evolving since it's conception.

Just need to write a big, well-worded disclaimer for it sometime

May make a blog post about the development history of the game up til now... might also release the first playable prototype from around July 2013 or so.

Hmm, it's already May 2014 and I haven't seen a prototype, where is it

Hmm, it's already May 2014 and I haven't seen a prototype, where is it

Well it's not like the game's had constant work done on it since then. It was, until now, just a few brief stints of work intersparsed with trying other projects. The current incarnation only really began semicontinuous work early this year.
Not sure if you didn't understand the joke and typo of your post or if its a joke replying to a joke.

Not sure if you didn't understand the joke and typo of your post or if its a joke replying to a joke.

Oh, I see what you were saying. I didn't make a typo - as I said, the prototype is from around July 2013, not that it was going to be released in July 2014.
Video of early prototype.

Cool! Prototype looks good.

...don't you dare wandering off to another project like you usually do, Nova

DO WANT tenchar

Any idea when Prototype Zero will be released?

The Very First SoTS fanart!

Edited May 26, 2014 by sal_vager

Any idea when Prototype Zero will be released?

Probably within a week or so. Doing some tweaks and finangling with its ancient horrible code to give it a little bit more functionality.

Dual-Planet cross section. Second SoTS fanart ever.

you tweaked the engine FX?

demo when.

Into the gas giant: You Killed your Lander. How does it feel?

Edited May 26, 2014 by sal_vager
Wonderful. The double planets are spot-on. I tweeted it, for you.
Maybe we're getting a bit carried away with tweaking this prototype... but I think it'll pay off in the end as it's now giving an experience a bit closer to what the final game will bring.
